meanings.definition: A member of a self-appointed group of citizens who undertake law enforcement in their community without legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The vigilantes patrolled the neighborhood to keep everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: The vigilantes caught the thief before the police arrived.
meanings.sent3: The vigilantes decided to organize a bake sale to raise funds for their patrols.
meanings.sent4: The vigilantes' presence in the town was like a shield against crime.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vigilantes in their uniforms became iconic in the small community.

meanings.definition: A person who takes the law into their own hands, typically to seek revenge or justice.
meanings.sent1: The vigilantes sought to avenge their friend's betrayal.
meanings.sent2: The vigilantes believed they were the only ones who could bring justice to the situation.
meanings.sent3: The vigilantes' plan to prank the prankster backfired hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The vigilantes' actions were a thunderous declaration of their defiance.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the vigilantes' bold move lingered in the minds of the townspeople.
